attributes.action: Ban the use & sale of prong &/or shock collars for cats & dogs in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: France, parts of Australia and other countries have long since banned these cruel training practices and the UK should be at the forefront of animal welfare. We cannot call ourselves a nation of animal lovers whilst allowing the sale and use of cruelty to “train” or punish animals. Whilst I appreciate there are many humanitarian issues to change we cannot ignore the voiceless that are our best friends.
attributes.background: As a veterinary student and experienced rescuer I can provide evidence that force related training techniques cause trauma, anxiety, physical and emotional pain and distress to animals. As an animal loving society I find it incredible that these tools of torture are not yet banned here.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Ban the use of aversive dog training tools
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728473
